info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 10 at 5:55AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center in Ketchum has ISSUED a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING which is in effect until 4 AM MST Thursday... * WHAT...The avalanche danger is HIGH. * WHERE...The Sawtooth, Western Smoky, and Soldier Mountains, including the mountains near Stanley, Smiley Creek, Atlanta, and Fairfield. The backcountry avalanche warning does not apply to operating ski areas. * WHEN...Until 4 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Natural and human-triggered avalanches large enough to bury people are almost certain to occur. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Stay off of and out from below steep slopes-slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Avalanches may be triggered remotely-from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steep slopes. Natural and human-triggered avalanches may run long distances and can impact gentler terrain below. Consult www.sawtoothavalanche.com or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
